refReminder: Your reference number is your National Insurance number

coronavirus.text1: We will contact you about your claim by %s.
coronavirus.text2: You can claim for up to 14 days for coronavirus isolation. For claims longer than 14 days we will contact you to book a 'Claimant Commitment' (opens in new tab) appointment. This is normally over the phone unless you have told us you need an alternative format.
coronavirus.text3: The date of your claim must be before 24 March 2022. This is due to the temporary regulations that provided eligibility to Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) if you had been affected by coronavirus ending.

non-shielding.h3: Send us your evidence to tell us you were self-isolating
non-shielding.li12: an isolation note online from NHS 111 (opens in a new tab), if you or your child were self-isolating in line with your government guidance and you could not work
non-shielding.li13: a notification from the NHS or public health authorities, if you had come into contact with someone with COVID-19
non-shielding.li14: the letter confirming the date of your procedure if you were advised by your doctor or healthcare professional to self-isolate before going into hospital for surgery

universalCreditYes.heading: Tell Universal Credit
universalCreditYes.text1: If you get or have applied for Universal Credit, you will need to tell them that youâ€™ve applied for New Style ESA. You can do this by signing in to your Universal Credit account (opens in new tab) and using the journal to contact your case manager.
universalCreditYes.text2: You must also enter details from your medical evidence into your Universal Credit account. For example, if you have a fit note, you do not need to send it to Universal Credit, but you must enter the dates.

feedback.feedbackQuestionLink: What did you think of this service? (opens in new tab). It takes 30 seconds.
feedback.researchQuestion: Volunteer to take part in research (opens in new tab) to help improve this service.
